item.title: Report E-2024070106
item.description:
Report E-2024070106

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-09T15:13:05+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-05
  • City: WEST CHESTER
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately 1/2 a cup of material released from one (1) 55-gallon poly drum. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and placed the spent absorbents into one (1) 5-gallon poly pail. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024070103
item.description:
Report E-2024070103

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-09T15:13:05+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-03
  • City: ST PETERS
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately five (5) gallons of material released from nine (9) 5-gallon poly pail. The released material impacted the tailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and recovered the spent absorbents and containerized it into one (1) 10-gallon metal drum. The damaged plastic pails were placed into two (2) 60-gallon metal drums. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

  • Description: RESPONDER WAS CALLED TO DOOR 20 OF THE UNLOAD FOR A LEAKING FLAMMABLE LIQUID HAZMAT. RESPONDER SHOWED UP WITH PPE ON AND SPILL CART. UTILIZING DECISION TREE AND FLAMMABLE LIQUID RESPONSE SHEET, RESPONDER CLEANED UP THE SPILL. LEAKING PACKAGE WAS PLACED INTO SPILL TUB AND TRANSPORTED BACK TO DMP CAGE FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

item.description:
Report I-2024070039

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-09T15:13:05+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-29
  • City: San Francisco
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED AIRLINES HOLDINGS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Halfway through the flight, passenger 20A, HOLUB/ALEXEIDAVID, told FA Pang that their laptop was emitting an electrical smell. FA conferred with FM and both agreed there was a smell. No flames, heat, or smoke were present. Out of an abundance of caution, the MacBook Pro was placed into the TCB. The TCB was placed in an aft Iav and monitored occasionally per CA instructions occasionally throughout the flight. The TCB remained in the aft Iav until descent, in which it was brought to the forward Iav for easy access upon door opening. Due to no signs of fire, smoke, or heat, pax was escorted to the exit and was able to retrieve the laptop out of the TCB. FAs reminded to fill out IORs and thanked for erring on the side of caution. Name: Alex Eidavid Holub Address: 36 Mayflower Drive Wenham MA 01984 Phone: 626-676-1736 Email: alexholub@gmail.com

item.description:
Report I-2024070036

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-09T15:13:05+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-22
  • City: Charlotte
  • State: RI
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: AMERICAN AIRLINES GROUP INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During offloading of the flight a mobility aid scooter arced with a flash and smoke when placed on the cargoveyor outside the aircraft cargo compartment. Upon opening of the battery compartment for the lithium ion battery, it was discovered that it was not the battery but one of the wires in the wire bundle had been pinched in the 2 halves of the battery housing leading to abrasion and a short circuit of the wire. There was some soot and evidence of burning where the wire came into contact with the metal frame of the scooter. There was no thermal runaway of the lithium ion battery although there could have been had the short continued.

  • Description: On 7/4/2024 at approximately 0528, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call for Employee 4992313 at the ramp facility in Welshpool, WA in Australia, reporting an undeclared dangeorus goods shipment. The shipment consisted of one fiberboard box, containing one box of Victoria Secret perfume. The shpment was discovered per the safety data sheet during a standard security check for liquids entering the country. The package does not appear to be prepared in acoordance withIATA Regulations, as it did not display the required markings, labeling, packaging, or paperwork. The shipment will be set for disposal because it can no longer be transported through the FedEx system.

THE OUTER BOX IS UN SPECIFICATION PACKAGING. NON SPILLABLE BATTERY IS NOT INDICATED ON THE OUTER BOX.

item.title: Report X-2024070319
item.description:
Report X-2024070319

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-08T18:15:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-28
  • City: OCEANSIDE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Package is an RTS from station 814. The exterior packaging had no orientation arrows, and no limited quantity diamond label on the FedEx repack box. The box is wet and hardened on the underside. Inside, a lot of paper filling materials were used. A clear plastic hazmat waste bag was used to contain the inner box that the shipment originally came with. The bag was secured haphazardly with a bunch of tape. The original outer box is wet all over and a diamond cut mark can be seen. The place where the limited quantity label used to be. This can be verified from the spidr image of the original package when it was picked up. Reviewing the DPR of the package, the package was not flagged as a dangerous goods, when in fact, 3 items of 2 different limited quantity was found. The original contents were 2 qty of 1 gallon metal container of Clear Guard EF, 1 metal can of Solvent Thinner, 1 qty 8 oz plastic container of Copper C Metal Coating, 1 qty of 8 oz Gold C Metal Coating, and 20fl oz high volume low pressure gravity feed spray gun. All items are products of Sculpt Nouveau. 1 container of Clear Guard EF was dented and the plastic seal for the lid came off and spill 3/4 of its contents. The Solvent Thinner was also dented and spilled from the cap around half of its content. The other gallon of Clear Guard EF was wet but salvageable, so are the metal coating, the content of the spray gun can be salvaged but the packaging is ruined. The package did not get a DG Nav Dangerous Goods Report when it was initially discovered but instead removed the Limited quantity diamond label and flagged the package non-hazardous and then RTS the package completely, including the damaged LQ.

item.title: Report E-2024070097
item.description:
Report E-2024070097

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-08T18:15:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-28
  • City: LAKELAND
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: LANDSTAR INWAY, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 28, 2024, at 1248 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Lakeland, Florida regarding the release of Injection Sour. Contractors were dispatched to the site to perform all onsite clean-up activities. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed the release of 10 gallons of Injection Sour (UN3412, 8, II) from (1) 55-gallon plastic drum. The release was caused by the drum being crushed from a load shift and contained to the trailer floor. Contractors transferred the remaining product in the damaged drum to a new 55-gallon plastic drum without complication. Contractors then neutralized and cleaned the release with absorbents and the proper PPE. All waste was containerized in (1) 55-gallon DF and staged onsite by contractors for proper disposal.

Contractors were dispatched to the site to perform all onsite clean-up activities. Upon arrival, contractors investigated and confirmed the release of 16 ounces of BIOTROL 12.5 (UN1791 Hypochlorite solutions, 8, III) from (1) 275-gallon IBC plastic tote. The release was caused by a loose lid and contained to the tote which contractors reported had completely dried. Contractors were able to successfully tighten the lid of the tote before departure. No waste was generated during this ER response.

  • City: MILLWOOD
  • State: WV
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 24, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN1824 was punctured in transit and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the trailer interior and asphalt beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel utilized hand tools, absorbents, and neutralizing agent to remediate the sodium hydroxide solution-impacted trailer floor and asphalt. All impacted material was collected and containerized into two (2) 55-gallon drums and staged on site for transport and disposal.

item.title: Report I-2024070002
item.description:
Report I-2024070002

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-08T18:15:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-20
  • City: Orange
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: SOUTHEASTERN FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: At approximately 18:25hrs 6/20/2024, Southeastern Freight Lines employee reversed a forklift out of trailer onto the loading dock and turned around when he pulled forward, he accidently punctured a 275-gallon tote IBC containing UN3264 product with the forks of the forklift this put a one-foot gash on the bottom comer of the tote. Causing approximately 200 gallons of product to be released on the loading dock, apron and parking lot. The forklift operator and out bound operations manager applied floor dry attempting to contain the product. The tote was maneuvered on its side in efforts to stop the spillage. None of the chemicals were near or entered any type of drain system. Southeastern Freight Lines Safety was notified approximately at 18:45hrs. Hazmat one was notified approximately at 18:54hrs. Hazmat contracted Oil Mop to the spillage Oil Mop arrived at the premises at approximately 20:36hrs. and advised most of the product has already dried up so they are going to start getting neutralizer down on it, put absorbent, and recoup it into poly drums. There is about 60-70g left in the old tote that they are going to transfer into a new tote and will dispose of the old one. 20:36hrs Hazmat one notified the Texas Spill Reporting Hotline at 800-832-8224 and spoke with Anthony he will notify region 10 the Report#20242263. 06/21/2024 15:20hrs Mop Oil called and said that they have finished cleaning the parking lot. They have moved inside and have sodium bicarb down on the floor. They will get all of this swept up and then must finish transferring the remaining product out of the tote. They are taking 4-drums with them for disposal and will have to return to get the tote of product later.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Driver stopped at the end of the day and was doing post-trip and saw moisture on the bottom of the trailer nothing was dripping but driver put down absorbent cloth just in case. The driver then called the emergency number at 2000ET. W crew was the dispatched and arrived at 1000ET. The discovered the the cap on the top of the tote was not secured properly and they fixed the cap. They then wiped up any residue that had come out approximately 2 cups and disposed of the material per the regulations. The clean up was completed at 1100ET.

item.title: Report E-2024070072
item.description:
Report E-2024070072

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-08T18:15:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-19
  • City: LUBBOCK
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: OCCIDENTAL CHEMICAL CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 19, 2024, at 8AM, an OxyChem driver arrived at Air Liquide in Lubbock, TX, to deliver Hydrochloric Acid. The driver checked in with security, then positioned the tractor and trailer at the unloading sight and met with the customer representative to sign the BOL, as well as OxyChem's "In the Interest of Safety" form. At approximately 8:10 AM, the unloading hose was connected to the customers flange, the trailer internal product valve was opened, and the air inlet valve to the trailer was opened. As the driver was opening the external valve, Hydrochloric Acid began to leak around the threaded connection of a CPVC ball valve that is part of the trailer blow down piping system. The driver proceeded to the front of the trailer where he closed the air inlet valve, and then around the truck to the left front trailer fender where he activated the emergency shutoff valve. He then contacted the customer representative to make them aware of the leak. Approximately 10 gallons of product leaked into a containment area. No injuries, chemical exposure or environmental impact resulted from this leak.

  • Description: Driver was exiting highway to stop at the facility and heard a whoosh sound thought he had blown a tire he stopped and checked and tires were good. He then proceeded to facility and when doing a post trip he noticed the top of the trailer had residue on it that had come from the pressure relief valve. He then called the emergency number at 0800ET. Crews were dispatched and arrive at approximately 1300ET to clean the residue off the tanker. The crew dawned the proper PPE and proceeded to clean the residue and dispose of the cleaning rags in the appropriate manor. The crew was complete at 1700ET.

  • Description: Spill. Hazmat, undeclared (no DOT labels/markings) and overweight (100lb. See 49CFR 173.27(f)(2)(iii) for LQ weight limit and FXG hazmat shipping guide page 8 for fully regulated weight limit). Leaking fiberboard box. 10x1gal Natures Pure 27% Hydrogen peroxide. 0.1 gal loss from failed safety seal below cap of one bottle. Please note that 1.800.633.8253 (found on product) was called and a request was sent to sds@ambipar.com for the SDS. Report will be updated when more information becomes available.

  • Description: On 7/1/2024 at approximately 1200, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 261690 at the ramp faiility in Anchorage, reporting a dangeorus goods spill. The shipment consisted one fiberboard box containig 4 plastic drums, individually packaged inside of smaller fiberboard box. One of the plastic drums leaked from the closure, resulting in spillage. This shipment was prepared under IATA Special Provision A197 and did not shipped as fully regulated DG. The shipper will be contacted for further disposition.

item.title: Report E-2024070035
item.description:
Report E-2024070035

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-05T18:14:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-01
  • City: Chandler
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: PACIFIC SCIENTIFIC ENERGETIC MATERIALS COMPANY (CALIFORNIA) LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 1, 2024, we received a package from Meggitt Safety Systems. The package that we received contained a Non-classified explosive material, that should have been shipped on a DOT-SP 8451 special permit pipe. The material arrived to our facility in a standard Uline 12x12x12 fiberboard box. These boxes are not UN popped for Hazardous materials. Inside that box was a FedEx "Small Box", that contained paperwork and 7 live explosive parts. Once opened the package was separated into different holding area for examination. As this was a return shipment to out facility, thankfully the parts were sealed in the factory ESD bags with labels. There were no hazardous material labels affixed to the outside of the container. No DG forms were completed. Because of the untested nature of the parts, they were required to be shipped in a DOT-SP 8451 special permit pipe. That pipe, per the permit should be, either a 4" or 6" schedule 80 seamless pipe, with closures at both ends, rated for containment of 25 g PETN. Also, the specific label should have read, Articles, explosive, n.o.s (*), 1.4E.

item.title: Report X-2024070126
item.description:
Report X-2024070126

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-05T18:14:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-28
  • City: OCEANSIDE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Package is an RTS from station 814. The exterior packaging had no orientation arrows, and no limited quantity diamond label on the FedEx repack box. The box is wet and hardened on the underside. Inside, a lot of paper filling materials were used. A clear plastic hazmat waste bag was used to contain the inner box that the shipment originally came with. The bag was secured haphazardly with a bunch of tape. The original outer box is wet all over and a diamond cut mark can be seen. The place where the limited quantity label used to be. This can be verified from the spidr image of the original package when it was picked up. Reviewing the DPR of the package, the package was not flagged as a dangerous goods, when in fact, 3 items of 2 different limited quantity was found. The original contents were 2 qty of 1 gallon metal container of Clear Guard EF, 1 metal can of Solvent Thinner, 1 qty 8 oz plastic container of Copper C Metal Coating, 1 qty of 8 oz Gold C Metal Coating, and 20fl oz high volume low pressure gravity feed spray gun. All items are products of Sculpt Nouveau. 1 container of Clear Guard EF was dented and the plastic seal for the lid came off and spill 3/4 of its contents. The Solvent Thinner was also dented and spilled from the cap around half of its content. The other gallon of Clear Guard EF was wet but salvageable, so are the metal coating, the content of the spray gun can be salvaged but the packaging is ruined. The package did not get a DG Nav Dangerous Goods Report when it was initially discovered but instead removed the Limited quantity diamond label and flagged the package non-hazardous and then RTS the package completely, including the damaged LQ.

item.title: Report X-2024070182
item.description:
Report X-2024070182

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-05T18:14:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-28
  • City: BATON ROUGE
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The package was found in the truck by the package handler from the night previous night. The package handler didn't notice the hazmat on the package because the label evaporated, and the box was torn and crushed. We had to research for the label and thankfully matched the package with the UN Number associated with the bottle. The two bottles that had ethanolamine, were found leaking from the bottom of the bottle. Seem as though there was no inner packing inside the package to protect the product. Being placed in a red bin and being held at the station. More pictures provided for additional information.

The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

  • City: MENOMONEE FALLS
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A Veolia employee was offloading a pallet from a trailer at Veolia's 10 day intransit facility in Menomonee Falls, WI when they noticed a spill of material upon moving a pallet. The bags on the pallet were poorly shrink wrapped, allowing for the material to shift due to vibrations while in transit resulting in tears to the bags. One bag released contents estimated to be in a quantity of approximately 10 lbs of hazardous waste. No injuries or chemical exposures were reported. The bags were overpacked for continued transportation to the disposal facility.

  • Description: An employee noticed leakage/wet spot under a trailer that was parked at Veolia's 10 day intransit facility in Sauget, IL.   • Description: During the unloading phase of trailer, employee was attempting to unload a pallet of freight with a forklift, the forklift blades were protruding past the pallet and punctured a pail in front of the pallet. Contact was made at the top side of the pail putting a 1.5 inch long puncture in the pail. Pail was then placed in a position to where the material would not leak further. All spillage of material was confined to immediate area for cleanup.

item.title: Report X-2024070123
item.description:
Report X-2024070123

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-05T18:14:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-21
  • City: MIDDLETOWN
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: 12 HOUR RESPONDER SUMMONED TO RECYCLE CHUTE FOR AN OPEN BOX WITH LEAKING CONTENTS. RESPONDER DONNED PROPER PPE, CONSULTED DECISION TREE RESPONSE SHEETS, TRANSPORTED THE PKG BACK TO THE DMP AREA FOR FURTHER PROCESSING. THE SIDE OF THE BOX WAS TORN, AND THE PAIL INSIDE WAS PROTRUDING FROM THE BOX. THE PAIL LID WAS SLIGHTLY AJAR, AND POWDER WAS LEAKING OUT. THE PAIL HAD A 5.1 OXIDIZER DIAMOND HAZARD LABEL, "UN 2468" "TRICLOROISOCYANURIC ACID, DRY" PRINTED ON THE PAIL. THERE WERE NO INDICATIONS OF A DANGEROUS GOOD ON THE OUTSIDE CARTON OR THERMAL LABEL. THE BOX HAD NO MANUFACTURER MARKS, UN SPEC MARKS, OR ANY INDICATION OF THE BOX STRENGTH. SHIPMENT CALLED INTO HMSC AS AN UNDECLARED HAZMAT. PKG AWAITING CLEARANCE FOR DMP DAMAGE PROCESSING IN ETT.

item.description:

  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 21, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of paint was punctured in transit and released approximately 25-gallons of product to the trailer interior and pavement beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from TPM Group (TPM) to remediate the impacted site. TPM identified the impacted areas of trailer that would need to be power washed and moved the trailer to the R+L washing station. The crew removed as much pigment from the paint as they could and moved onto power wash the pavement that was impacted. The total waste resulted in 2 drums of waste and one over pack for the damaged container.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 21, 2024, three (3) 50-pound bags of UN3378 were torn by a forklift and released approximately less than one (<1) pound of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Alpha Omega Training and Compliance (AOTC) to remediate the impacted site. AOTC personnel utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the UN3378-impacted trailer. All waste was collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum and staged onsite for transport and disposal. The damaged bag was patched and repalletized for shipment.

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 21, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of paint was punctured by a forklift and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the impacted site. LSH personnel deployed granular absorbents to the released paint in the trailer and swept them in with hand tools. Crews wiped down the impacted freight and pallet with absorbent pads and degreaser. The spent absorbents and cleanup debris were placed into one (1) 5-gallon bucket, and the one (1) 5-gallon pail of damaged product was placed into one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

The driver then called our emergency number at approximately 2030 ET. The team was dispatched and arrived at 2230ET and found the a 5 gallon drums lid had come off and the liquid had splashed over the top. They then removed the container and put it into a salvage drum and wiped up any residue found and disposed of the absorbents in the appropriate manor. The result was less than a gallon released. The clean up was complete at 0330.

WHILE PROCESSING THE PACKAGE, DISCOVERED THE PACKAGE CONTAINED AN AEROSOL, RESPONDER NOTED THE LACK OF APPROPRIATE HAZARD LABELS, AND SET PACKAGE ASIDE SO UNDECLARED HAZMAT PROCESS COULD BE FOLLOWED.

item.description:
Report E-2024070037

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-05T18:14:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-14
  • City: DOLTON
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CLEAN HARBORS ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The driver arrived at his destination where he noticed liquid dripping from trailer the driver then put down some absorbent pads and notified the facility. The onsite team and created a containment and then preceded to get a team together to enter the trailer. They were eventually able to get a crew that was trained to enter the trailer. The team showed up at 0830 to begin unloading and cleaning up any residue as needed. The crew discovered a drum with a pin hole they removed the lid and discovered that it was mostly full of wags and very little liquid. We believe that the wrags were blocking the hole and when in transit they would move around allowing it to leek ocasinaly. The crew then placed it into a salvage drum and cleaned up and disposed of the adsorbents and rags used properly. the clean up was completed by 1130.

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that 0.5-ounce of 2-Methoxyethoxymethyl chloride (hazardous - UN2810) was released. The caller stated that the released product was contained to the outside containers. The terminal requested a contractor out for cleanup and containment. ERTS dispatched SET Environmental to assist with cleanup. The product release was contained to the damaged drum and all other drums were confirmed secured. All other drums were secured to the pallet and will continue to the destination. The leaking drum was overpacked into a 55-gallon metal drum for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024070036
item.description:
Report E-2024070036

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-05T18:14:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-12
  • City: UNDERWOOD
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CLEAN HARBORS ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Driver stopped at rest area to take a break and to check on his load. When the driver walked around he noticed a drip coming from his trailer onto the drive tire he then though down some absorbent. The driver than called our emergency response line and a team was dispatched out at approximately 0845. The crew arrived at 1100 to investigate they found 3 drums that the lids were not secured tightly. The then unloaded the trailer to gain access to the containers wiping up any residue on the floor as they went. The 3 drums lids and rings were then tightened securely. The absorbents used to clean up the residue were then disposed of properly. The crew was done at 1700.

One of the glass bottles inside was found broken and the entire contents leaked out. The bottles were in a plastic bag filled with vermiculite, however the bag was unable to contain all of the spill. The package as placed into a salvage drum and the shipper contacted for disposition.

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-24
  • City: MC ALLEN
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: HAZMAT RESPONDER DISCOVERED DAMAGED AND LEAKING CARTON ON PALLET OUTSIDE DMP AREA, INSIDE TOTE. CORROSIVE DIAMOND HAZARD LABEL WAS CLEARLY VISIBLE, SO SHE DONNED PPE, INCLUDING SILVER SHIELD GLOVES, AND PROCEEDED TO NEUTRALIZE THE LEAKING ACID WITH SODIUM BICARBONATE. RESPONDER VERIFIED THAT THE SUBSTANCE WAS NEUTRALIZED USING PH TAPE. THE CONTAMINATED CARDBOARD, CLAY ABSORBANT, SODIUM BICARBONATE AND THE ENTIRE AUTOMOTIVE BATTERY WAS PLACED INSIDE A GREEN BAG. MORE SODIUM BICARBONATE AND CLAY ABSORBANT WERE ADDED TO THE BAG IN ORDER TO CATCH ANY MORE ACID THAT MAY LEAK FROM THE BATTERY.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 20, 2024, one (1) 95-gallon overpack of sodium hypochlorite fell off of a skid and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. Crews re-secured the fallen tote. TLE personnel deployed granular absorbents and cleaners to impacted dock and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 35-gallon drum.

item.title: Report E-2024070000
item.description:

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-19
  • City: SAN LORENZO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 19, 2024, one (1) 330-gallon tote of UN3265 was punctured by fallen freight and released approximately three (3) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Ancon Services (AS) to remediate the impacted site. AS personnel utilized hand tools, neutralizers, granular absorbents and absorbent pads to the UN3265-impacted trailer floor, wooden slab, tote exterior and swept them up. AS deconstructed the wooden slab and conducted a gravity tote transfer into a new 330-gallon poly tote. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 30-gallon drum. The original tote was deconstructed with and collected into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum.

ISR personnel deployed granular absorbents and a neutralizing agent to remediate the site. All spent absorbents and debris were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum. item.title: Report E-2024060133
item.description:
Report E-2024060133

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-03T15:13:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-04
  • City: CINCINNATI
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On Tuesday, 6/04/2024, at 1121 hours, an FRA Hazmat Inspector in the CSXT Queens Gate Yard discovered UTLX676824, a loaded tank car of Ammonium Nitrate, liquid, had leaked from the Vacuum Relief Valve (VRV). The car was isolated and the shipper, CF Industries Sales LLC, was notified via CHEMTREC (Report#2024-0604-00147). CSXT Hazmat personnel responded to the yard and observed dried product within the service equipment housing that had leaked from the VRV. The valve was not actively leaking at the time of response. The issue was identified as a defective Vacuum Relief Valve and corrective actions were communicated to the shipper’s representative, Roy Mathew, 224-804-7190, rmathew@cfindustries.com. The car was held out of transportation pending repair or replacement of the defective valve by a certified mobile repair unit.

item.title: Report E-2024060053
item.description:
Report E-2024060053

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-03T15:13:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-03
  • City: BOYKINS
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 1500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 6/3/24, at 1232 hours, personnel in the NCVA Railroad Boykins, VA Yard discovered GBRX709256, a loaded tank car of Sodium Hydroxide Solution, had leaked from the top of the car. The car was isolated and the shipper, Chemserve Terminals, was notified via CHEMTREC 2024060300092. Hepaco, a CSXT emergency response contractor, was dispatched to the scene as well as a representative from Chemserve Terminals and found the air line valve open and secondary closure plug not installed. The issue was identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shipper’s representative- Matt Law 757-544-0784. Contractor personnel closed the valve and reinstalled the plug and decontaminated the car. The leak was secured and the car was released for transport.

  • City: NICHOLS

  • Carrier/Reporter: KAG SPECIALTY PRODUCTS GROUP, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 1
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6550
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: The KAG Specialty Products Group, LLC driver arrived at the customer location and was preparing to initiate the delivery. It appears that a valve on the trailer was left in a partially open position. When the driver removed the discharge cap approximately 10 gallons of Bonderite C-IC was released. A portion of the spilled product sprayed on the driver and resulted in him seeking medical treatment. T&R Environmental responded to the scene and handled the remediation.
